models.agents: The specialist AI agents that analyze different aspects of development questions. Each agent has a specific domain of expertise.
models.agentActivity: Real-time status of agents as they work on a query, showing progress and completion state.
models.agentContributions: The findings and conclusions from each agent that contributed to an answer, with source citations.

relationships: Each Agent can have multiple AgentActivity states as it processes queries
AgentContributions link an Agent's findings to a specific response with citations

agents.name: Zoning Interpreter
agents.description: Analyzes zoning codes, land use regulations, and district classifications

agents.name: Incentives Navigator
agents.description: Identifies financial programs, grants, tax incentives, and funding opportunities

agents.name: Feasibility Analyst
agents.description: Assesses project viability by synthesizing inputs from other agents

agents.name: Design Advisor
agents.description: Evaluates architectural guidelines, design standards, and review board requirements

agents.name: Permit Pathfinder
agents.description: Maps permit requirements, application processes, and approval pathways

agents.name: Compliance Checker
agents.description: Verifies code compliance, identifies violations, and suggests remediation

agentActivityDemo.query: Can I build an ADU on my property at 2847 N Fratney St?

agentContributionsDemo.query: Can I build an ADU on my property at 2847 N Fratney St?

contributions.finding: Property is zoned RS6 (Residential Single-Family). ADUs up to 800 sq ft are permitted as accessory structures.

citations.title: Accessory Dwelling Units in Residential Districts

contributions.finding: Property qualifies for STRONG Homes Loan program offering up to $60,000 at 0% interest for ADU construction.
No Architectural Review Board approval required. Property is not in a historic district or design overlay zone.
Project is highly feasible. Estimated cost $85,000-$120,000 with potential rental income of $1,200-$1,500/month. ROI timeline: 6-8 years.
Required permits: Building Permit, Electrical Permit, Plumbing Permit. Estimated timeline: 4-6 weeks for approval. Total fees: approximately $1,800.

agentContributionsDemo.summary: Yes, you can build an ADU on your property. Your RS6 zoning allows ADUs up to 800 sq ft, and you may qualify for $60,000 in 0% financing through the STRONG Homes program.
